snippet: Monday’s late-night, 123-page ruling by Judge Andrew S. Hanen forced President Obama to abruptly halt plans to protect millions of undocumented immigrants.
abstract: Obama administration is struggling for response to Federal District Court Judge Andrew S Hanen's ruling stopping executive orders to protect millions of undocumented immigrants from going into effect; Justice Dept spokewoman says no decision has been made on an emergency application to an appeals court, but vows a fight to any such challenges to Obama's actions.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ADAM LIPTAK
byline.contributor: Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Monday’s late-night, 123-page ruling by Judge Andrew S. Hanen forced President Obama to abruptly halt plans to protect millions of undocumented immigrants.

headline.main: White House Struggles on Immigration Ruling
headline.print_headline: White House Struggles on Immigration Ruling
